data.title: Maria Corazon Sumulong (Cojuangco) Aquino (1933-2009)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Corazon (Cojuangco) Aquino born 1933 San Juan de Dios Hospital, Intramuros, Manila, Metro Manila, Philippines died 2009 Makati, Metro Manila, Philippines including ancestors + children + 2 photos + 1 genealogist comments + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Maria Corazon Sumulong (Corazon) "Cory" Aquino formerly Cojuangco

Born 25 Jan 1933 in San Juan de Dios Hospital, Intramuros, Manila, Metro Manila, Philippines

Ancestors

Wife of Benigno Simeon Aquino Aquino Jr. — married 11 Oct 1954 (to 21 Aug 1983) in Pasay City, Metro Manila, Philippines

Mother of [private daughter (unknown - unknown)], Benigno Simeon Cojuangco Aquino III and Kristina Aquino

Died 1 Aug 2009 at age 76 in Makati, Metro Manila, Philippines

Problems/Questions

Profile last modified 3 May 2024 | Created 24 Jan 2015

This page has been accessed 4,158 times.

Nakaraang sinundan

Ferdinand Marcos Pangulo ng Pilipinas

25 Pebrero 1986 – 30 Hunyo 1992 Sinundan ni

Fidel V. Ramos

Biography

Corazon (Cojuangco) Aquino is Notable.

11th President of the Philippines, the first woman to hold that office, and the first female president in Asia.

Maria Corazon "Cory" Sumulong Cojuangco was the fourth child of Jose Cojuangco, Sr. and Demetria Sumulong. Her siblings were Pedro, Josephine, Teresita, Jose, Jr. and Maria Paz. Both Aquino's parents came from prominent clans. Her father was a prominent Tarlac businessman and politician, and her great-grandfather, Melecio Cojuangco, was a member of the historic Malolos Congress. Her mother, Demetria, belonged to the Sumulong family of Rizal who were also politically influential; Juan Sumulong, a prominent member of the clan, ran against Commonwealth President Manuel L. Quezon in 1941.

She married Sen. Benigno S. Aquino, Jr., son of the late Speaker Benigno S. Aquino, Sr. and a grandson of General Servillano Aquino. The couple had five children, four daughters who are still living and a son, Benigno Aquino III, who would later serve as the 15th President of the Philippines.

Sources

"Philippines, Manila, Civil Registration, 1899-1984," database with images, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:QKJ5-MRF1 : 11 November 2017), Corazon Sumulong Cojuangco in entry for Benigno Simeon Aquino, 08 Feb 1960; Birth, 08 Feb 1960, City of Manila Civil Registrar, Philippines; FHL microfilm 1,581,031.
